Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre

Class Session

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.Session
public class Session extends Object
A session gathers several important elements together and provides a single way for them to interact with each other: a parser and printer to read and write, a problem being solved, a planner and its current search, etc.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Session()
    Constructs a new session with a default parser, default printer, and a heuristic progression planner.

      public Session()

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • getStatus

      public Worker.Status getStatus()
      Returns the session's current status object, to which updates are written when the session is modified, when a problem is being compiled, when the search is running, and during other time-consuming operations. If the current status has been set to null, a new status will be created and returned.
      Returns:
      the current status

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(Worker.Status status)
      Sets the session's current status object, to which updates will be written when the session is modified, when a problem is being compiled, when the search is running, and during other time-consuming operations.
      Parameters:
      status - the new status to use

    • getParser

      public Parser getParser()
      Returns the session's current parser, which is used to read problems, logical formulas, and other inputs. If the current parser has been set to null, a new default parser will be created and returned.
      Returns:
      the current parser

    • setParser

      public void setParser(Parser parser)
      Sets the session's current parser.
      Parameters:
      parser - the new parser to use

    • getPrinter

      public Printer getPrinter()
      Returns the session's current printer, which is used to convert plans and other outputs into text. If the current printer has been set to null, the default printer will be returned.
      Returns:
      the current printer

    • setPrinter

      public void setPrinter(Printer printer)
      Sets the session's current printer.
      Parameters:
      printer - the new printer to use

    • getProblem

      public Problem getProblem()
      Returns the session's current Problem problem that the planner will solve.
      Returns:
      the current problem
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the problem has not been set

    • setProblem

      public void setProblem(Problem problem)
      Sets the session's current problem and removes the session's current compiled problem, current state, current goal, current search, latest result, etc.
      Parameters:
      problem - the new problem to solve

    • setProblem

      public void setProblem(File file) throws IOException, ParseException
      Sets the session's current problem after parsing a given file using the session's parser.
      Parameters:
      file - the problem file to be parsed
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs while reading the file
      ParseException - if an exception occurs while parsing the file

    • getCompiledProblem

      public Problem getCompiledProblem()
      Returns the session's current compiled problem. If the current problem has not yet been compiled, it will be compiled.
      Returns:
      the problem, pre-processed by the planner
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the problem is not set
      IllegalStateException - if the planner is not set

    • setCompiledProblem

      public void setCompiledProblem(Problem compiled)
      Sets the session's current compiled problem and removes the session's current state, current search, latest result, etc. This method does not remove the current (uncompiled) problem; it should only be called with a compiled version of the current problem. This method does not remove the current goal, because even through the initial state may change as a result of compiling the problem differently, the goal may not change.
      Parameters:
      compiled - the new compiled problem to solve

    • getState

      public State getState()
      Returns the state in which planning will start. If the state has not been set, the problem's initial state will used.
      Returns:
      the state in which planning will start
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the initial state is not set and cannot not be calculated

    • setState

      public void setState(State state)
      Sets the session's current state (the state from which planning will begin). If the session has a current search, its start state will be updated.
      Parameters:
      state - the new state to start in

    • getGoal

      public Number getGoal()
      Returns the current goal, the author utility that a plan must achieve to be considered a solution. If the goal is not set, a default value is used, which is the author's utility in the current state rounded up to the nearest whole number, or the author's utility +1 if the utility is already a whole number.
      Returns:
      the current goal
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the goal is not set and cannot be calculated

    • setGoal

      public void setGoal(Number goal)
      Sets the session's current goal. If the session has a current search, its goal will updated.
      Parameters:
      goal - the new author utility plans must reach to be considered a solution

    • setGoal

      public void setGoal(double goal)
      Sets the session's current goal using a Java double.
      Parameters:
      goal - the new author utility plans must reach to be considered a solution

    • getPlanner

      public Planner<?> getPlanner()
      Returns the session's current planner.
      Returns:
      the current planner

    • setPlanner

      public void setPlanner(Planner<?> planner)
      Sets the session's current planner and removes the session's current compiled problem, current search, latest result, etc.
      Parameters:
      planner - the new planner to use

    • getSearchLimit

      public long getSearchLimit()
      Returns the current planner's search limit setting.
      Returns:
      the current planner's search limit

    • getMethod

      public ProgressionPlanner.Method getMethod()
      Returns the search method used by a heuristic progression planner, if the current planner is that type.
      Returns:
      the search method
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current planner is not a heuristic progression planner

    • getExplanationPruning

      public boolean getExplanationPruning()
      Returns the explanation pruning setting used by a heuristic progression planner, if the current planner is that type.
      Returns:
      whether explanation pruning will be used
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current planner is not a heuristic progression planner

    • setExplanationPruning

      public void setExplanationPruning(boolean value)
      Sets the explanation pruning setting used by a heuristic progression planner, if the current planner is that type.
      Parameters:
      value - whether explanation pruning should be used
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current planner is not a heuristic progression planner

    • getNumSolutions

      public int getNumSolutions()
      Returns the number of solutions the search should find before finishing.
      Returns:
      the target number of solutions

      public void setNumSolutions(int num)
      Sets the number of solutions the search should find before finishing.
      Parameters:
      num - the number of solutions

    • closeOut

      public void closeOut()
      Closes the session's output stream

    • getDistance

      public DistanceMetric getDistance()
      Returns the distance metric with which to compare the solutions.
      Returns:
      the session's distance metric

    • setDistance

      public void setDistance(DistanceMetric metric)
      Sets the distance metric with which to compare the solutions.
      Parameters:
      metric - the distance metric

    • getSearch

      public Search<?> getSearch()
      Returns the session's current search, which was created by the session's planner for the session's problem. If there is no current search, one will be created.
      Returns:
      the current search
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a new search needs to be created, but the problem, state, goal, or planner are not set

    • setSearch

      public void setSearch(Search<?> search)
      Sets the session's current search, and removes the most recent result, etc. This method is protected by default, and is only used to unset the current search (i.e. set the current search to null). If this method is given public access, it should update all of the session's other settings, such as the current problem, current search limit, etc.
      Parameters:
      search - the new search to use

    • getResult

      public Result<?> getResult()
      Returns the result of a new run of the session's current search. If the search has not been created, it will be created. If it has already been run, it will run again and find a different solution.
      Returns:
      a new search result
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the search needs to be run but it cannot be created

    • getSuccess

      public boolean getSuccess()
      Indicates whether or not the most recent search succeeded in finding a plan that meets or exceeds the author's goal utility. If a search finds a plan which improves the author's utility, but not up to the goal, it may still return that plan. This means that getSolution() may still return a plan, even if this method returns false. If the search has not been created, it will be created. If it has not been run, it will be run.
      Returns:
      true if the most recent search returns a result whose plan meets or exceeds the author's goal utility
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the search needs to be run but it cannot be created

    • getSolution

      public Solution<?> getSolution()
      Returns the solution from the session's current result. If the search has not been created, it will be created. If it has not been run, it will be run.
      Returns:
      the solution from the current result
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the search needs to be run but it cannot be created

    • getSolutions

      public StorySpace getSolutions()
      Returns the list of solutions found by the search so far.
      Returns:
      the solutions from all runs of the search

    • getPlan

      public Plan<?> getPlan()
      Returns the author's plan (that is, just the actions the author intends) from the session's current result. If the search has not been created, it will be created. If it has not been run, it will be run.
      Returns:
      a sequence of actions that can be taken in the current state that will improve the author's utility
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the search needs to be run but it cannot be created

    • getPlan

      public Plan<?> getPlan(Character character)
      Returns the current plan for a given character from the session's current result. If the search has not been created, it will be created. If it has not been run, it will be run.
      Parameters:
      character - the character whose plan is desired, or null if the author's plan is desired
      Returns:
      a sequence of actions the given character believes can be taken from the current state to improve their utility
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the search needs to be run but it cannot be created, or if the current result's solution is not a solution object
